item.title: Partial Index Tracking
item.description: Cornell University | Ithaca, NY 2020.02 - 2020.05 • Constructed portfolios that replicated the behavior of S&G500 within the Markowitz framework. • Improved objective function with regularization terms to encourage sparsity and efficiently tracks an index. • Enhancing the model by introducing transaction costs to select more liquid securities.

item.title: Machine Learning Competition (Kaggle)
item.description: University of British Columbia | Vancouver, BC 2020.12 • Cleaned, merged, and processed 100,000+ complex raw data sets, facilitating analysis and pattern recognition. • Used Python to develop a linear autoregressive model to predict future Covid-19 statistics, ranked within the top 20% in the competition. • Utilized cross-validation to tune hyperparameters and improve accuracy, decreased errors by 30%+.
